course_title: Management of Adult Voice and Fluency Disorders

learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse and synthesise theoretical knowledgerelated to normal and disordered voice and fluency in adults.(SPA PS Standards 1.1, 1.2)

Conduct comprehensive assessmentsof adult voice and fluency disorders, incorporating observational, perceptual, and psychosocial measures within an ICF framework to support differential diagnosis and treatment planning.(SPA PS Standards 1.5, 3.1, 3.2)

Formulate and implement individualised, evidence-based intervention plansfor adult voice and fluency disorders, drawing on advanced clinical reasoning and multiple theoretical approaches.(SPA PS Standards 1.6, 1.7, 3.3, 3.4)
Adapt and evaluate therapy approachesto support effective, sustainable implementation, including home practice, outcome monitoring, and responsiveness to change.(SPA PS Standards 1.6, 3.4, 3.5)
Demonstrate person- and family-centred care, using collaborative goal setting and shared decision-making in assessment and intervention planning.(SPA PS Standards 1.4, 3.4, 3.5)

Deliver culturally safe and responsive care, designing and evaluating interventions that respect and affirm cultural, linguistic, and gender diversity, including the needs of transgender and gender-diverse individuals.(SPA PS Standards 1.6, 3.4, 3.5)

Demonstrate readiness for professional practice in adult voice and fluency, integrating clinical reasoning, ethical conduct, and practical skills in simulated settings (e.g., OSCEs and case-based simulations).(SPA PS Standards 1.3, 1.4, 3.3, 3.5, 4.1)

All quizzes will contain multiple choice questions.
assessments.task_description:
There will be a series of seven (7) weekly knowledge check quizzes in this course. Your five (5) highest scoring quizzes will make up your grade (2% each).The two (2) quizzes that you receive the lowest marks for (which may include any quizzes that are not submitted) will not contribute to your grade. Quizzes will cover content from weeks 1-6 and 8. Each quiz opens during the content week but is due the following Wednesday at 1pm (e.g., the Week 1 quiz opens in Week 1 and is due Wednesday of Week 2 by 1pm). *Please note, the final quiz is due on the Wednesday of the end of semester exam period.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All quizzes will be undertaken through an assessment link provided in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This is a MUST PASS examination.

This in-semester exam will assess knowledge and skills acquired from weekly pre-recorded lectures and tutorials in relation to the assessment, diagnosis, and management of voice and fluency disorders (Weeks 1-5). This assessment will encompass short answer questions including case-based questions relating to assessment interpretation, differential diagnosis and management options for voice and fluency disorders. Students will also be required to perform an online assessment of stuttering behaviours and vocal features from a video recording during this exam.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Voice/ Fluency Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE)
assessments.category: Examination, Practical/ Demonstration, Role play/ Simulation
assessments.task_description:
This Objective Structured Clinical Examination (OSCE) is comprised of two stations: 1) adult with a voice disorder and 2) adult with a fluency disorder. Prior to the commencement of each OSCE, you will receive case information relevant to the case. You will have 15 minutes to review the case information and plan for the session. You will then enter the clinic room and meet your client. You will have 15 minutes to conduct each session where you will:

a. Provide a brief outline of the session

b. Summarise findings from initial assessment session/ obtain a speech sample and identify stuttering behaviours

c. Provide education regarding the presenting disorder and rationale for chosen treatment

d. Implement chosen treatment technique and provide feedback to client as required

e. Conclude the session

You will then rotate to the next station to complete the second OSCE.

This assessment task is to be completed inperson. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Online self-directed learning

Pre-recorded lecture content will be available on Blackboard across weeks 1-8. It is expected that students will engage with this content prior to attending the weekly tutorials. Up to four (4) hours of pre-recorded lecture material (voice and fluency content combined) will be provided on the course Blackboard site each week.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Weekly on-campus tutorials

Weekly tutorials (2 x 2 hour tutorials) will be held in weeks 1-3 and 5-8 of semester. Tutorials will be practically-based and will facilitate student understanding and application of the course content. Week 7 tutorials will focus on OSCE preparation in readiness for end of semester practical assessment.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
